fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on the Configure button from the installed Insight Discovery app leads admins to an invalid link to download Discovery Tool 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Insight Discovery 3.1.3 via UPM or using the obr file from [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214668/insight-discovery/version-history].
 # Upon successful installation, click on the Configure button to navigate to the page when the Discovery Tool zip file can be downloaded.
 # Download the Discovery Tool zip file.

h3. Expected Results
The Discovery Tool zip file is downloaded

h3. Actual Results
The Discovery Tool zip file is not downloaded as the link leads you to a HTTP 404 error page. Clicking on the Configure button on step 2 above brings you to <Jira_base_URL>/secure/DiscoveryDownload.jspa while the correct link should be <Jira_base_URL>/secure/admin/DiscoveryDownload.jspa.

h3. Workaround
* Ensure the URL looks like <Jira_base_URL>/secure/admin/DiscoveryDownload.jspa
or
* Navigate via Administration > Manage apps, Discovery Download is available on the left menu
 !image-2022-01-04-16-37-33-416.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Invalid Discovery Download link in the Insight Discovery app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As a JSM administrator, there are possible situations when it might make sense to want to modify an SLA goal and have all corresponding issues recalculate (including issues that have already met the goal/non-ongoing SLAs). For instance: if the 'Time to first response' SLA goal was mistakenly typo'ed and a number of issues were opened and responded to (i.e., the goal hit a Stop condition) before the mistake was noticed and corrected.

According to our documentation, [Setting up SLAs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/setting-up-slas-939926373.html]:
{quote}
h5. Updating SLAs

When you change the configuration of existing SLAs, we follow these rules:
 * We don’t recalculate, or touch in any way, cycles that have already been completed. A cycle is completed when a request fulfills the Start and Stop conditions (depending on your configuration and events, another cycle of the same SLA might then be started).
 * We recalculate ongoing SLAs so they measure against your new configuration and metrics.

It might happen that ongoing SLAs will be completed or discarded entirely after changing the configuration. This can happen if you remove the previous Start or Stop conditions or change them to something else, which will trigger the completion. As mentioned earlier, ongoing SLAs will be recalculated to use your new configuration.
{quote}
h3. Suggested Solution

A configuration option to select whether non-ongoing SLAs are affected by SLA goal configuration changes should be added to allow Administrators the option of modifying historical SLA data.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Configuration option for resetting non-ongoing SLA goal values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new automation rule - if you indicate a Description to the rule (regardless of the Rule Configuration itself - which can be with any Trigger / Condition / Action) - saving the Rule will remove the description.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In any Insight Schema, navigate to the Schema Configuration>Automation tab and create a new Automation rule
 # Give the rule a Name and include a description
 # Set Trigger (any will work), no need for Condition (IF), and set any Action
 # Save the Automation rule

h3. Expected Results

The newly saved Automation rule is saved, and all its details are kept
h3. Actual Results

The Automation rule is saved, but has no Description, in the DB, the rule shows Description as null
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Create the Automation rule with no description, save it. 

Once saved - edit the rule and add the description - save the edited rule, and the Description will be saved.
fields.summary: Insight - Automation Rule Creation deletes the Description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When loading objects by REST API, non-admin users may see a slower response time (1.5x to 3x as long on average) than Jira Administrators.

This behavior also occurs when searching for and loading objects in the Insight UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Although this behavior occurs in the Jira UI as well, it is easy to demonstrate via the REST API. Query 5,000 issues via REST, for example:
{code}
curl '<jira_base_url>/rest/insight/1.0/iql/objects?iql=Id%20LIKE%20%22CVE%22%20ORDER%20BY%20Updated%20DESC&resultPerPage=5000' -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:95.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/95.0' -H 'Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8' -H 'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br' -H 'Connection: keep-alive' -H 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1' -H 'Sec-Fetch-Dest: document' -H 'Sec-Fetch-Mode: navigate' -H 'Sec-Fetch-Site: none' -H 'Sec-Fetch-User: ?1' -H 'Cache-Control: max-age=0' --output result.json
{code}
# Using a REST client, first specify credentials for a user with Jira Administrators permission.
# Perform the same query with credentials for a user without that permission, but with the same Insight Object Schema and Object Type permission levels.

h3. Expected Results

The time taken to complete the queries should be similar in both cases.

h3. Actual Results

The total request time takes 1.5x to 3x longer for the user without Jira Administrators permission. 

This is particularly noticeable on environments where there are many object references. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Slow response times for non-admin Jira users when querying Insight objects via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

One JSON import synchronization generates duplicated objects, even though Identifier is unique.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # This is not reproducible in house - only in one customer's environments.
 # A Jason file is being generated daily, accessed by the Insight JSON Import, using a URL. File is being generated in advance, way before the import initiates.
 # Almost every run will create new objects, some of these objects will be created twice, always in the same 3 object types.
 # Duplicated objects seems to be random, with no pattern, not always created in all 3 object types.
 # Identifier is unique - tested with various combinations of identifiers, ended up with single datalocators mapped to text attributes, and the issue persists.
 # Recreated the import configuration, made sure no rogue/corrupt configuration exists in the DB.
 # Recreated the object types from scratch, and their attributes to no avail.
 # The results are random duplicated objects, created within 15m apart.
 # The youngest instance will get ALL its outbound references set, while the older instance will have some but not all, always the same reference attributes are missing. (An attribute is mapped with 3 datalocators, all combined in one IQL query on the attribute map.
 # Multiple attempts to reproduce this behavior in house, using JSON file from the customer's instance, and replicating the Structure (object types involved) - resulted without success. The import works as expected and no duplicates are being created.

h3. Expected Results

No duplicate objects are present following the completion of the JSON import
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: One JSON import synchronisation generates duplicated objects, even though Identifier is unique

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Help Center* within the *Customer Portal* of JSM project does not return any knowledge-base articles from Confluence when a high number of JSM projects are linked to unique Confluence spaces.

This is due to the API payload sent to the Confluence "{{{}knowledge-base/1.0/search"{}}} endpoint exceeding *256 characters* which is the character limit set in Confluence. This is being tracked on the Confluence side in CONFSERVER-33174.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link a Jira and Confluence instance using Application Links.
 # Create multiple Confluence spaces (keys: JSM1 - JSM13).
 # Create multiple JSM projects (keys: JSM1 - JSM13).
 # Link each of the individual JSM projects to their respective Confluence space within the *Project Settings -> Knowledge base* page, such as the *JSM1* Jira project to the *JSM1* Confluence space.
 # Navigate to {{/servicedesk/customer/portals}}
 # Perform a search with one of the Confluence space keys, such as {*}jsm1{*}.

h3. Expected Results

Articles matching the query string are displayed on the main Help Center page.

!Screen Shot 2021-12-22 at 1.17.17 PM.png|width=335,height=401!
h4. +Debug Logging (org.apache.http)+
{code:java}
2021-12-22 13:20:02,189-0600 http-nio-48202-exec-11 DEBUG admin 800x1283x2 1x9w72o 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/shared/search [o.a.h.impl.execchain.MainClientExec] Executing request GET /c7132/rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&queryString=%28jsm2%29+AND+%28spacekey%3A%22JSM2%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM1%22%29&pageSize=3&startIndex=0&highlight=true&xoauth_requestor_id=admin HTTP/1.1
{code}
h3. Actual Results

No articles are displayed on the main Help Center page.

!Screen Shot 2021-12-22 at 1.40.04 PM.png|width=335,height=401!
h4. +Debug Logging (org.apache.http)+
{code:java}
2021-12-22 13:38:48,044-0600 http-nio-48202-exec-8 DEBUG admin 818x2061x2 1x9w72o 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/shared/search [o.a.h.impl.execchain.MainClientExec] Executing request GET /c7132/rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&queryString=%28jsm1%29+AND+%28spacekey%3A%22JSM81%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM91%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM2%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM3%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM1%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM6%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM131%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM7%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM4%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM5%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM101%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM111%22+OR+spacekey%3A%22JSM121%22%29&pageSize=3&startIndex=0&highlight=true&xoauth_requestor_id=admin HTTP/1.1
{code}
h3. Workaround

Due to the nature of the bug, the only workaround is to reduce the amount of unique spaces linked to each of the JSM projects until the query string is less than 256 characters.
fields.summary: Help Center returns zero Confluence articles if payload exceeds 256 characters

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When importing objects using the AWS Insight Integration and setting the "Missing Objects" handling to "Delete," the time taken to delete missing objects can sometimes increase the overall import time significantly. 

This is due to the time taken to delete object references on related objects. Before proceeding with importing the next object, the integration waits until the delete operation has completed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Delete missing objects asynchronously from the rest of the import. Allow new objects to be imported while the existing objects are deleted either at the end of the import process or in a separate process thread.

h3. Why this is important

When setting Duplicate Objects to Delete for an AWS import, if there are many hundreds of related objects, this can slow the import process down quite a lot. We have observed cases where the import takes 14x as long as when not deleting duplicate objects -- a 30 minute import takes 7 hours.  

h3. Workaround 

You can use a new attribute and automation to delete duplicate objects outside of the import:
# Create a status attribute for each object type named "Soft Delete" with statuses (for example) "Active" and "Deleted"
# In the object type import configuration, set Missing Objects to Update, and chose the attribute you created (Soft Delete). Set the Soft Delete status to Deleted.
# You can later delete these objects manually by filtering for them and using a bulk delete. Alternately, you can schedule an automation rule to delete them on a set schedule.
fields.summary: AWS Insight Integration import is slow when deleting missing objects with a large number of references

When a comment is added with text and a picture in the ticket, a notification is sent to the people assigned to the ticket. This leads to the fact that the customers who received the e-mail notification and replies to my comment in the thread from there. The below lines are shown in the email and comment

Unable to embed resource: xxxxx of type application/octet-stream

h3. Actual Results

When the customer replies to the notification which has attachments then When he adds a comment with text and a picture in the ticket, we get this message in the comment and mail chain

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Replying to Notification email when a comment is added with attachments adds Unable to embed resource: xxxxx of type application/octet-stream in comment

fields.description:
In [this Cloud documentation for importing into CSV|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/import-a-csv-file-into-insight/#Importing-CSV-files], we mentioned
{quote}
If you are importing objects from a CSV file into Insight, you must identify the objects by the attribute that is assigned as a Label, not their Name or Key.
{quote}

It's good to also have this included in the Server and DC version of the documentation, for example, in [2. Create object type and attribute mapping|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/2-create-object-type-and-attribute-mapping-1044784497.html#id-2.Createobjecttypeandattributemapping-Createattributemapping] under _Identifier_.

An explanation for why Name or Key shouldn't be the identifier would be great too.
* Object key is generated automatically when an object is created manually or via import. Even if the object key is present in the source file (say CSV or JSON), a new object and with new object key will be generated instead of using the one in the source file especially if object key is the identifier. This could result in multiple "duplicates"
fields.summary: In Server/DC documentation, mention and explain why object name or object key shouldn't be the identifier

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight allows the uploading of attachment with forbidden character, example discovered so far: 
{code}
[
]
{code}

The filename is sent to the client verbatim, with out any encoding, which is illegal. 

The affected URL is http://localhost:48202/j8202/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/<ID>/<FILENAME>

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to an Insight Object
 # In lower left hand corner, upload attachment with forbidden character, eg, [IMG_1701.jpg
 # Note the upload succeeds
 # Click the attachment file name

h3. Expected Results
Attachment downloads
h3. Actual Results
The image fails to load, instead showing an error 500 page:

Sorry, we had some technical problems during your last operation.

Cause:
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index 60: http://localhost:48202/j8202/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/1/[IMG_1701.jpg
	at java.base/java.net.URI.create(URI.java:883) [?:?]
	at javax.ws.rs.core.UriBuilder.fromUri(UriBuilder.java:95) [jsr311-api-1.1.1.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:153) [?:?]
	at com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.ServletContainer.doFilter(ServletContainer.java:829) [?:?]
...
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.service(Http11Processor.java:616) [tomcat-coyote.jar:8.5.65]
...
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128) [?:?]
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628) [?:?]
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61) [tomcat-util.jar:8.5.65]
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:829) [?:?]
Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 60: http://localhost:48202/j8202/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/1/[IMG_1701.jpg
	at java.base/java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2913) [?:?]
	at java.base/java.net.URI$Parser.checkChars(URI.java:3084) [?:?]
	at java.base/java.net.URI$Parser.parseHierarchical(URI.java:3166) [?:?]
	at java.base/java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3114) [?:?]
	at java.base/java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:600) [?:?]
	at java.base/java.net.URI.create(URI.java:881) [?:?]

{code}

h3. Workaround
h4. Workaround 1
Delete the attachment, and re-upload using a filename without forbidden character

h4. Workaround 2
This workaround will seamlessly correct the problem for [ and ] characters. 

# Edit JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/urlrewrite.xml
# Add the following above the {{</urlrewrite>}} tag
{code}
    <!--
        JSDSERVER-10975 Encode Insight Attachment forbidden characters

        A rule is required for each character being blocked. Only the first <to> element requires the context path (if applicable) Tuckey is prepending the context path on subsequent request. 

        The $1 is the attachment ID, and $2 is the filename sent to the client.
        Condition is required to prevent unlimited redirects. 
        The to sections encode [ and ] to %5B and %5D respectively. The unencoded characters are illegal according java.net.URI.create which our rest module uses. Redirection was required. We can't use ${encode} because it encodes space to +
    -->
     <rule>
        <name>1/2 IAL JSDSERVER-10975 Encode [</name>
        <from>/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/(.*)/(.*)</from>
        <condition type="request-uri">rest/insight/1.0/attachments/.*/(.*\[.*)</condition>
        <condition type="method">GET</condition>
        <to type="redirect">/YOURCONTEXT/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/$1/${replace:$2:\[:%5B}</to>
    </rule>
    <rule>
        <name>2/2 IAL JSDSERVER-10975 Encode ]</name>
        <from>/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/(.*)/(.*)</from>
        <condition type="request-uri">rest/insight/1.0/attachments/.*/(.*\[.*)</condition>
        <condition type="method">GET</condition>
        <to type="redirect">/rest/insight/1.0/attachments/$1/${replace:$2:\]:%5D}</to>
    </rule>
{code}
# If you have a context path (EG http://sample.com/jira/browse/TEST-12345), then replace YOURCONTEXT. If you have no context path, remove {{/YOURCONTEXT}}
# Restart Jira service
fields.summary: Accessing an attachment in Insight with forbidden character results in error 500

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an Attribute to an Object Type, it may be configured accordingly.

If no Value was set in that Attribute for any object, the Type may then be changed.
Previous configuration may be kept, e.g. "Show Sum" - which will break the rendering of Objects in the List View, where Show Sum is applicable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object Type "OTA" with a few objects
 # Navigate to the OTA>Attributes Tab, and Add an Attribute "Test" Type:default, Type value: Integer. Click Add
 # Click the Cog to configure this Attribute, and check the option Show Sum (available for any Numeric Attribute Type). Click Update
 # Since no Value was set for this attribute - change the Type of the Attribute to Object, and Type value to OTA Object type (or any other). click Update.
 # Switch back to Objects and edit one object to have a Value in the Test Attribute. Click Update
 # Switch to List View, add the Test Attribute using the Columns button

h3. Expected Results

Error rendering objects TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'length')
    at Number.countDecimals (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:7019)
    at Object.<anonymous> (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:7040)
    at Function.each (batch.js?locale=en-CA:43)
    at Object.<anonymous> (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:7027)
    at Function.each (batch.js?locale=en-CA:43)
    at child.rerenderList (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:7022)
    at child.render (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:6824)
    at child.render (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:7238)
    at Object.RLABS.Objecttype.Object.render (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:6691)
    at Object.success (com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight:rlabs-insight-general.js?locale=en-CA:6782){noformat}

h3. Workaround

To fix this - go to the Attribute configuration, and click Update without making any changes. This will clear the incorrect settings, and allow viewing the List view correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight custom field on a transition screen with filter issue scope configured does not load objects on parent issues if user starts browsing its child issue first
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 Insight custom fields. For simplicity let's say A, B and C.
 ** A has a simple custom field configuration with just an IQL that loads all objects of an object type, put this field on a Create issue screen.
!A-config.png|thumbnail!
 ** B should loads objects based on the object chosen in A, put this field on a transition screen. Sample configuration
!B-config.png|thumbnail! 
** C has a similar configuration as A, put this field on the same transition screen as B's. This field is just to show that it's not affected if it doesn't have filter issue scope configured.
 # Create an issue with the custom field A filled.
 # Create a sub-task from the issue created above.
 # Browse a sub-task issue using the search box on the top right side of any Jira page.
 # On the sub-task issue, click on the breadcrumb link to go to the parent issue directly.
 # On the parent issue, click on a transition that has an Insight custom field on the transition screen.
 # On the transition screen, click on the Insight custom field and choose an object.
(i) [^JSDSERVER-10972.mov] contains steps starting from step 4

h3. Expected Results

Both fields B and C returns a list of expected objects
h3. Actual Results

Field B returns no match but after a refresh of the page, the field returns a list of expected objects. Field C returns all expected objects without having to refresh the page
h3. Workaround

Refresh the parent issue page before transitioning or refresh the transition screen
fields.summary: Insight custom field on a transition screen with filter issue scope configured does not load objects on parent issues if user starts browsing its child issue first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We had a customer reporting a bug where Jira Service Desk (Version 4.5.0) there is in _Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()_ a class loader that does not have the _javax.mail.jar_ in its classpath, they found a workaround for this case and they have described it in the issue commented below.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # To reproduce, Register a custom IMAP store implemantation and configure a Project to receive emails. Then, send a message that contains a multipart (for example a signed email). Inside your custom IMAP implementation, just write out the message into a string and then load it again into a MIME message.

h3. Expected Results

When calling getContent() on the message, you get a Multipart.
h3. Actual Results

When calling getContent() on the message, you get a SharedByteArrayInputStream.
h3. Workaround

Setting the context class loader in our custom IMAP folder implementation to the class loader provided by the _javax.mail.Message_ class. This fixes the Problem. But still, other developers might stumble into the same problem.
fields.summary: Invalid context class loader for IMAP emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Attribute value report" in Insight sums numeric attribute values.
The "Float" Attribute type, holds values with 2 decimal values (2 digits after the decimal point).
The "Attribute value report" will show 2 decimals until a longer decimal is inserted to the DB (e.g. by an import)
From that point on, the Report will show many decimals.
The FLOAT_VALUE Column holding the float value in the db is of the type "Double Precision". 
Fresh DB did not show this behavior, until a longer value was inserted in any other object type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object Type with a Float Attribute
 # Create a few Objects, and populate the Float with values like 1.22, 2.56, 42.42 etc.
 # In Insight>Reports, click to create a New Report, and choose the Attribute Value report.
 # configure the Report to look into your Schema>Object Type>Float Attribute and generate the report. Notice the results - the accumulated value show in the format nn.mm (two digits after the decimal point - (/) )
 # Add another object with the Float value 1.123456 and re-sync the report - notice the total now shows nn.mmmmmm
 # Delete the Object in step 5, and re-sync the Report again.

h3. Expected Results

Report shows the accumulated value as nn.mm
h3. Actual Results

Accumulated values are showing as  nn.mmmmmm
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Screenshot: have 202 Objects with a Float Value 1.1
Added 1.1234 then deleted it. !https://files.slack.com/files-pri/TA9RVNGNR-F02R275P80J/image.png!
fields.summary: Insight - Attribute Value Report showing to many decimals

h3. Issue Summary
Discovery scan does not retrieve the right number of VCPUs vs CPUs
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # enable Windows patterns (WMI or PS)
 # set Discovery to scan Windows hosts where CPUs number is different than VCPUs number
# observe that the commands executed for both patterns:
{quote}
WMIQuery
Windows_CPUs.pat
SELECT * FROM Win32_Processor
{quote}
and
{quote}
PowerShellExecute
Windows_CPUs_PS.pat
Get-WmiObject Win32_Processor
{quote}

Are always retrieving the same number of CPUs and VCPUs even if number of VCPUs is different as we can see in Windows device management system info.

This goes for several different Win versions.

h3. Expected Results
The command executed should retrieve the correct number of VCPUs
h3. Actual Results
The command executed do not retrieve the correct number of VCPUs

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Discovery scan does not retrieve the right number of VCPUs vs CPUs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unlike Jira Software projects, Jira Service Management projects do not permit a user to be assigned to an issue unless they have Browse Project permission – even when that user has "Assignable User" permission
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample JSM project
 # Create a sample, non-admin user. Add them to a sample group
 # Grant the sample group JSM licensing using Applications -> Versions & Licenses
 # Grant the group *Assignable User* permission on the project's Permission scheme
 # Ensure the user and group do not have Browse Projects permission on the permission scheme

h3. Expected Results

The user is able to be assigned to an issue within the project
h3. Actual Results

When assigning the user to an issue, the error appears

{panel:title=User 'USERNAME' cannot be assigned issues. |borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#f5c6cb|titleBGColor=#f5c6cb|bgColor=#f8d7da}

{panel}
h3. Cause
Issues can only be assigned to JSM agents. JSM agents are expected to always have the Browse Projects permission for the JSM project. 

h3. Feature request
Modify the behaviour to be more flexible, and allow issue assignment even if that user does not have Browse Projects permission for the project
fields.summary: User cannot be assigned issues in JSM project without Browse Projects permision

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight Custom Field configuration showing old attribute name after Insight Object attribute has been renamed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Insight attribute within the desired Object Type. In this example, we will call the field "Manufacturer"
 !image-2021-12-13-10-13-05-300.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new Insight Custom Field ("Affected Computer" in this example) > Edit Insight Configuration > add the "Manufacturer" field on the list in the "User Interaction" section:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the Object Type configuration and rename the field (e.g. to Fabricator):
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Insight Custom Field configuration is updated and attributes selections (User Interaction section) show updated attribute name.
* The new attribute name is automatically updated on the issue view.

h3. Actual Results
* Insight Custom Field configuration still shows old attribute name withing User Interaction section.
* The renamed attribute is not even being shown on the issue view:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Indexing Insight will not help in this case.

h3. Workaround
On the Insight Field Configuration screen, remove the old attribute and add the renamed attribute from the lookup / dropdown.
fields.summary: Insight Custom Field configuration showing old attribute name after Insight Object attribute has been renamed

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating jira issues, Insight Referenced Custom Field holds incorrect values which are not depending on the parent field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Consider the following use case: There are 2 Insight custom fields - a regular Insight custom field and a Referenced custom field.
 # Create an Insight Schema
 # Create 2 Object Types
 ## One of the object Type has an Outbound reference to the other
 ## Create a few objects
!Objects.png|thumbnail!
 # Create 2 Insight Custom Fields
 ## A regular Insight custom field
 ## Referenced custom field
 ## Use the following configuration
!Service CF.png|thumbnail! 
!Category CF.png|thumbnail!
 # Add them to the appropriate screen
 # Go to Jira Dashboard URL and click on "Create" with "Open link in new tab" \\
{code:none}
http://{JIRA URL}/secure/Dashboard.jspa
{code}
 # Fill in both Insight CFs on the create issue window.
 ## Insight Referenced Custom Field will be wiped out as soon as the parent custom field is either removed or changed. This is expected.
 # On the same page, we now click on "Create", a new Create pop-up screen will be displayed, the Referenced Custom Field, aka "Category" still holds the previous value regardless the value on the parent custom field (Service)

h3. Expected Results

Insight Referenced Custom Field will be wiped out as soon as the parent custom.
h3. Actual Results

Insight Referenced Custom Field holds incorrect values.
!Result.png|thumbnail!

Please also refer to the following recording: [^Reference_CF.mov]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight Referenced Custom Field holds incorrect values when creating Jira issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user without permission on all attributes edits the object the restricted attributes are deleted. This happens only on the new object view page.
This looks like a regression of and old bug [ICS-1358|https://insight-jira1-bckp.itplat.atlassian.com/browse/ICS-1358] affecting the new object view page

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Log in as Admin
# Create an Object Type - A, with an Object Attribute Type (Reference) to reference Object Type B
# Create an Object A1 referencing Object B1
# Grant Manager permission to User X on Object Type A. 
# Make sure User X does not have any Permission on Object Type B - so the Attribute in (2) is not visible to User X
# Log in as User X, note that you can see Object A1, but you do not see the Attribute containing Object B1
# Open the object in the new object view page {{http://<BASE-URL>/secure/insight/assets/XXX-1234}} as User X
# Click Edit and save with/without making any changes

h3. Expected Results
The restricted attribute(s) from User X are kept intact

h3. Actual Results
The restricted attribute(s) from User X are deleted
!2021-12-10_14-09-17.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

The old object schema view is no longer impacted by this bug. Ask users to edit restricted objects from the old view {{http://<BASE-URL>/secure/ObjectSchema.jspa?id=XXX&typeId=YYYY&objectId=ZZZ}}
fields.summary: Restricted attribute(s) deleted when object edited by user without all attribute permissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While editing an object if attribute validation fails, all date/datetime attributes gets updated unnecessarily. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Object Type - A 
#* Add a couple Date/DateTime attribute for Object Type - A
#* Add a URL type attribute (for validation)
# Create an object populating the date/datetime attribute(s) and URL attributes populated
# Edit the object and edit the URL attribute in a way that it fails the URL validation (remove the "https://" or "http://" from the URL prefix)
# Once the invalid URL error is thrown edit the URL correctly (prefix "https://" or "http://") and save

h3. Expected Results
Only the URL attribute update is stored in object history

h3. Actual Results
Along with the URL attribute, Date/DateTime attributes are also updated. This affects both Old schema view as well as new object view page.
!2021-12-10_13-15-28.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Object attribute validation failure causes unwanted date/datetime attribute update

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Approvers" custom field that is set up by JSD/JSM does not have a Search Template applied to it, so is not indexed which means it can't be used in JQL searches/results/boards/etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Jira administration -> Issues

                      !image-2021-12-09-12-06-28-755.png|width=106,height=178!

       2. Fields -> Custom fields

       3. Go to "Approvers" field and select "Edit"



                      !image-2021-12-09-12-08-33-603.png|width=346,height=173!
h3. Expected Results

"Search Template" should be set to "User Picker & Group Searcher"
h3. Actual Results

You will see that  "Search Template" is set to "None" by default
h3. Workaround

Manually change Search Template for "Approvers" custom field and reindex Jira
fields.summary: Approvers custom field not indexed by default

This is not ideal for the downstream applications consuming insight data.

fields.description:
In Insight if you want to, for example, trigger an Import using REST API, you will need to pass the import configuration id. See: [Rest API import|https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/#import]

The ID is not obvious to know, as you need to navigate to the Process Results Tab (to the right of the Import Tab) and click Details for any of the successful results for the "Object Schema" Import.
 !image-2021-12-08-13-43-18-748.png|thumbnail! 


We need a better way (more easy and intuitive) to know this import configuration ID.
fields.summary: Better way to identify Object Schema import configuration ID

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h1. User Story

As an IT director attempting to generate reports on my ITSM work managed in Jira Service Management, I would like to be able to access data being stored about my tickets as columns, because I need to be able to generate reports using this information that Jira cannot do natively.
h1. Context

- Jira Service Management stores _all sorts_ of useful information about issues. For example, JSM issues contain information about how they were created in the "request.channel.type" field; indeed, you can filter on this dimension in a JQL search. However this field is not available as a column in Issue Navigator, so you cannot easily export it into a file and use it for reporting.

- Reporting in general, and historical and artifact reporting in particular, are weaknesses of JIRA. This necessitates us to export Jira data for use in other tools.
fields.summary: Allow "request.channel.type" to be a column in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
As a Jira Administrator, it would be very nice to have a currency attribute value type, to be used on calculations and reporting activities in Jira. 

h3. Work-around
Currently, this is possible to add float and/or integer numeric types, but these may not be as accurate as a currency type depending on the calculation. 
This is also possible to use a string with regex validation, but the values will not be able to be calculated.
fields.summary: Implement currency attribute value type for Insight objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue

In a fresh Jira Service Management installation, the field *Approvers* which comes out-of-the-box with Service Management is configured without a search template by default in *⚙ > Issues > Custom Fields > Approvers > Edit*:
 !Screenshot 2021-12-03 at 15.48.03.png|thumbnail! 

Because of that, this field is not searchable, and the following errors will be displayed in the issue search page when trying to either search with this field, or order the search results by this field:
- Error when searching with this field:
{code}
Field 'Approvers' is not searchable, it is only sortable.
{code}
 !Screenshot 2021-12-03 at 15.50.25.png|thumbnail! 
- Error when ordering with this field:
{code}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{code}
 !Screenshot 2021-12-03 at 15.50.01.png|thumbnail! 

The problem is that users are not necessarily aware that the search template is not set by default for this field (while it is for most out-of-the-box fields).

h3. Suggestion

Set the search template to *User Picker & Group Searcher* by default, to avoid any confusion.
fields.summary: Make the approvers field searchable by default

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there's an object with a boolean attribute and a user tries to import from a file that does not have a value for this specific boolean (true or false) the result will be that the object will have an empty boolean (completely missing in the object view).
Note: In manual creation of an object (not imports) the boolean will always have a default value of "false" that's why there should be a default value for imported objects as well.

As a result, if the user tried to filter objects based on that boolean (either "true" or "false") they will not appear in the results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object with a boolean attribute. i.e.: Object "Item" with boolean "Available".
 # Create a simple CSV file that has 3 items (one with "true", the second with "false" and the third with an empty value for the boolean attribute field).
 # Import from that CSV.

h3. Expected Results
The boolean values for the objects should be true, false, false respectively. 

h3. Actual Results
The boolean of the third object will be empty (completely missing)
 !image-2021-12-03-15-47-57-906.png|thumbnail! 

This will result that this item will not show up in the IQL search or filters:

 !image-2021-12-03-15-50-14-339.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

An automation rule can fix this problem. (See screenshot) 

 !image-2021-12-03-15-19-31-317.png|thumbnail! 

This is ideal for small environments (with little numbers of booleans) but in a big environment with lots of booleans this will be a bit difficult since an automation rule will be required for each boolean.
fields.summary: Importing an object that's missing a boolean value in the CSV file leads to having an empty value in the object's boolean in Insight.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight Reports scheduled to run Daily, Weekly, Monthly or Advance (CRON expression) stop synchronising randomly.

Issue has been observed in multiples Insight version such as Insight 9.0.12, 8.9.3 and 8.9.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue is not easily reproducible and exact steps are not yet determined.
 # Create 2 Insight reports, for example type "Object search". Any other type may be affected
 # Set them up to run Daily, Weekly, Monthly or Advance (CRON expression). Example:
!cron.png|thumbnail! 
!daily.png|thumbnail!
 # The first time, they will run successfully
 # The next runs, reports might not be synced. Again, not all circumstances of successful reproduction are known.
 # When issue occurs, in Jira Administration > System > Scheduler Details > {*}io.riada.jira.plugins.insight.widget.scheduler.GeneratingJob{*}, will not be there so no reports seems to have any scheduled task.
 # In the db "AO_8542F1_IFJ_WIDGET" we can indeed see the reports created successfully

h3. Expected Results

Reports should be synced
h3. Actual Results
 * Reports are not synced.
 * The following screenshots were taken on Friday Nov 3 2021 at 11:30 AM CET
 ** Report 'daily' should have been triggered at 00:00 on Nov 3 but did not. As we can see, last run was on  Thursday 11:50 when it was created. 
!daily report.png|thumbnail!
 ** Report 'Report 1' should have been triggered at on Friday Nov 3 at 6 AM but did not. As we can see, last run was on Wednesday 8:55 am when it was ran manually. 
!cron report.png|thumbnail!
 * On jira database, "SYNCHED_AT" column shows that none of them were triggered on Nov 3.
!database.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Edit the reports and Save them again without any changes made. However, this is not a solution.
fields.summary: Insight Reports stop synchronising randomly

fields.description:
Hi,

When importing CVE data using the NVD plugin for insight the upper/lower bounds for affected versions are not being included in the default import configuration.

For example, in the raw CVE json feed you can see:
{noformat}
          "cpe23Uri" : "cpe:2.3:a:apache:subversion:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*",
          "versionStartIncluding" : "1.9.0",
          "versionEndExcluding" : "1.10.7",{noformat}
From the default import it pulls the vendor/product/version from the cpe, however the specific affected versions are not included in their own attribute.

Is this something that can be included in the plugin?

Thanks,

Lewis
fields.summary: Insight NVD Plugin - Specific Version Information on Import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight object graph show unrelated references to customers on portal
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a schema create an object type that has 2 depth of attributes references outbound and an attribute of type user (ex. object type Host):
 !Screenshot 2021-11-30 at 16.46.12.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create objects for the object type and the referenced object types

 !Screenshot 2021-11-30 at 15.16.13.png|thumbnail! 

*NOTE*:

The issue here is specific related to customers as per the permission granted from the Insight object schema roles to customers, they are in fact able to browse all the objects through the object graph when they should not.

h3. Expected Results
Customer should not see objects that do not belong to his user
h3. Actual Results
Customer is able to browse all the objects tree of references (Inbound and Outbound) descending the objects

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring the Insight Object Schema Import Type, with predefined structure and predefined configuration; the structure creates correctly, but the configuration is mixed up; Attributes are not being mapped (seems to relate to Attribute names and types), object types are not mapped to their corresponding Object Types...
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Empty Schema "Source" with 3 Object Types: Parent 1, Parent 2, Parent 3
 # Under each Parent OT, create a Child OT (No inheritance is required) and give each of these the name "Office" (no numbering - name must be the same for all 3 object types). Use different Icons for each, so they will be distinguishable later.
 # On the "Office" OT (OTID=4), Child of Parent 1; create 3 Text type attributes: A1, A2, A3
 # On the "Office" OT (OTID=5), Child of Parent 2; create 3 Text type attributes: A1, B1, B2
 # On the "Office" OT (OTID=6), Child of Parent 1; create 3 attributes: A1 (User Type), C1, C3 (both Text)
 # Create a new, empty Schema "Target" and configure an Object Schema Import
 # When prompted - create a predefined structure and a predefined configuration
 # Revise the structure (schema, Object Types and Attributes) - should be correct, similar to the Source
 # Revise the configuration (you may also use the Import Admin menu option to Inspect Configuration)

h3. Expected Results

All Object Types and their respective Attributes are mapped correctly and respectively:
Office (child of Parent 1) is mapped to the new Schema's Office (Child of Parent 1) - and all Attributes are mapped correctly.
The same for the other 2 Office Object Types.
h3. Actual Results

Office (Parent 1) from Source is mapped to Office (Parent 2) in Target >>  can be noted by looking at the OT Map Icon, and checking the Selector on the Object Type Map configuration. 
In this case Map for the Office (under Parent 1) is indicating Selector: Office;5 (meaning the Office Object Type with OTID=5 in Source, which is the Office under Parent 2....)

As for Attributes:
Office (Under Parent 1 and 2 in TARGET) Object Type Maps are only mapping the common Attribute A1 in both, A2, A3, B1, B3 are not automatically mapped

Office (Parent 3) is all mapped correctly - respective OT and ALL its Attributes, as A1 has a different Attribute Type than the other 2 Office OTs...
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually correct the Selector to include the correct Source OTID.
Manually add mapping for each Office OT.
fields.summary: Insight Object Schema Import Type may result in misconfiguration, when there are multiple Object Types with the same name in source

fields.description:
Hi, I'm Gunwoo Park.

I have a user pool and want to let my users to log into JSD through my user pool. There is no "email" information in my user pool, so I'd like to use "sub" for Open ID Connect.

I need to create a corresponding JSD user programmatically for each user and I've checked JSD REST API and found POST /rest/servicedeskapi/customer.

There is a problem with the mentioned endpoint, which is I cannot set "username" as whatever I want. The JSD REST API document says "The customer's username is their email address", which is obviously a different behavior with JSD Admin Webpage where I can set "username" as whatever I want.

This prevents me from assigning "sub" as "username" since the endpoint requires me to insert a valid email address, which cannot cover the sub format like 00567bd3-afe3-4eac-b123-b9e49aa1aca0.

I suggest you to consider adding a new input paremeter "username" on POST /rest/servicedeskapi/customer, which will allows me to create JSD users with sub as username.

I'll be looking forward to hearing from you. Thank you.
fields.summary: How to Set Custom Username When Creating Users Through JSD REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an Insight custom field is created to hold values based on another field (the issue type for instance), if the original field was selected then the insight field value got set everything will be just fine. However, if then the original field got changed to something else the value in the custom field will not be reset (i.e. be cleared) and keeping the already selected object as it is. As a result, an issue can be created with an object that does not correspond to the original field or in the case of a referenced field the value will also disappear from the service portal in the customer's view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce - 1/2

original field will be the issue type
 # Create two different issue types in a project (Software and Hardware for example).
 # Create an object type "Assets" and add a text attribute named "Issue Type".
 # Create object "Keyboard" and fill in the "Issue Type" with "Hardware".
 # Create object "Photoshop" and fill in the "Issue Type" with "Software".
 # Create an Insight custom field that would filter objects based on the selected issue type.
Custom field name: Affected Item.
Filter Scope IQL: ObjectType = Assets
Filter Issue Scope (IQL): "Issue Type" = ${issuetype.name}
 # Create a new issue, select the issue type as "Hardware" and the Affected Item as "Keyboard"
 # Now change the issue type to "Software".

 # 
 **  

h3. Expected Results

The "Affected Item" custom field should be cleared so that it's more obvious for the agent to reselect a new value.
h3. Actual Results

The previously selected object "Keyboard" will remain present in the custom field (from example 1)

!image-2021-11-24-15-56-03-908.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The user needs to be careful if he makes an update on the issue type he should not forget to update the custom field accordingly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce - 2/2

original field will be another Insight field and this time the child field will be an Insight referenced field
 # Create 2 different object types
 ** *brand*
 *** add 2 objects e.g. (logitech and corsair)
 ** *keyboard*
 *** add the brand as a reference attribute on the keyboard object
 *** add 2 objects and choose the brand e.g.
 **** K95 -> corsair
 **** G915 -> logitech
 # Now go into Jira and create 2 custom fields
 ** create an "Insight objects" field for "{*}brand{*}"
 *** _make sure to associate the field_ _with_ _the appropriate screens_
 ** Edit the "Insight Configuration" for the "brand" field
 ** set the "Object Schema" to whatever schema you used above
 ** set the "Filter Scope (IQL)" to "{{{}objectType = brand{}}}"
 ** create an "Insight Reference Object (single)" fields for "{*}keyboard{*}"
 *** _make sure to associate the field with the appropriate screens_
 *** _this can also be a multiple field_
 ** Edit the Insight Configuration for the "keyboard" field
 ** set the "Parent Custom Field" to "brand"
 ** set the "Reference direction" to "Inbound references"
 ** set the "Filter Issue Scope (IQL)" to "{{{}objectType = keyboard{}}}"
 *** _this step can be skipped if you don't have other object types_
 # Add the 2 fields now to a workflow transition screen
 ** Go to the Project
 ** choose any workflow that you want this visible on
 ** edit the workflow
 ** click on the transition (e.g. Start progress)
 ** click on the screen for that workflow transition
 ** add the 2 custom fields and then go back to the project
 # create a new issue for this project
 ** make sure to select the 2 fields appropriately (so that the values are populated with objects)
 # now click on the (Start progress) transition button
 # then delete or change the value in the brand field
 ** you will noticed that it does not clear the value in the referenced field
 ** at this point if you have a service type configure to display these 2 fields, you can load the service portal (customer view) and the second field should be missing from the page. 

 
h3. Expected Results

The child item (Insight Reference Object) should be cleared so that it's more obvious for the agent to reselect a new value.
h3. Actual Results

The child item (Insight Reference Object) is not cleared

!image-2021-12-02-10-56-28-066.png|width=340,height=56,thumbnail!
fields.summary: A dependant custom field value won't get cleared if the field it's depending on is changed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Import with "Missing objects: Update" rule clears the value of "Attribute to edit" if external Data locator value has changed. This is happening despite the fact the object has not been missing.

This is happening only for existing objects that have been updated (changed) by the import (for example, if some mapped attribute gets modified during the import).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure your Object has an attribute that will be used with "Missing objects: Update" Import rule
 # Create an import that will:
 ** Have "Missing objects: Update" rule configured
 ** Select your attribute in "Attribute to edit" field, and set "New value of attribute to edit" to the desired value.
 ** Set your desired threshold
 # On the external source, edit some value of a Data Locator, so that this change will get reflected on the Insight attribute after the sync
 # Run the import manually

h3. Expected Results

The modified data coming from Data Locators get synced to Insight attributes, and "Attribute to edit" will not change since the object is not missing (hence, no need to update the attribute).
h3. Actual Results

The modified data coming from Data Locators get synced to Insight attributes, but also, value of "Attribute to edit" gets cleared (current attribute value gets removed).

Example:
 * We have "Status" attribute that becomes set as Active when a Person gets sync with LDAP import:
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 * LDAP import configuration that will set "Status" to Inactive if the Person is missing after the threshold has been reached:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * After the "User principal name" gets changed on the directory side, and after we sync the LDAP import, the "User principal name" Insight attribute gets changed, "Status" value also gets cleared, which is not expected:
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
 * Tested with CSV and LDAP import, possible that other import types are affected.
 * Affected attribute types are Status and Boolean, possible that other attribute types are affected.

h3. Workaround

Create an Automation rule that will restore the cleared value to its original value. This can be used only if existing objects have a predefined, known value for the attribute that is supposed to be changed by "Missing objects: Update" rule.

For example, this Automation rule will set cleared value for "Status" attribute to Active, which was the value that gets cleared by the import:
!screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Import with "Missing objects: Update" rule clears the value of "Attribute to edit" if external Data Locator value have changed

fields.description:
Currently, it is possible to change a custom field's context and remove a specific project, while the custom field is configured in request types in that project. When done, there is no warning or error that indicates the consequences of that change which are:
 * Creating the request from the customer portal will return a 500 ERROR and 'Null' in the response.
 * Creating the request from the rest API will return a 500 ERROR with no explanation about the reason for failure.
 * There is no obvious error logged in the application or Catalina logs in these cases.

Attaching HAR files and browser console logs for reproducing from GUI.

[^Browser Console log.log]

REST API response below:
{code:java}
curl -D- -u username:password -X POST --data '{"serviceDeskId": "1","requestTypeId": "1","requestFieldValues": {"summary": "Request JSD help via REST - removing field","description": "I need a new mouse for my Mac","customfield_10200":"2017-08-16T14:21:00.000-0500"}}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:8080/rest/servicedeskapi/request -v
Note: Unnecessary use of -X or --request, POST is already inferred.
*   Trying ::1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 8080 (#0)
* Server auth using Basic with user 'maria'
> POST /rest/servicedeskapi/request HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8080
> Authorization: Basic bWFyaWE6bWFyaWE=
> User-Agent: curl/7.64.1
> Accept: */*
> Content-Type: application/json
> Content-Length: 221
>
* upload completely sent off: 221 out of 221 bytes
< HTTP/1.1 500
HTTP/1.1 500
< X-AREQUESTID: 929x961x1
X-AREQUESTID: 929x961x1
< Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
< Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000
< Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=9CCB5304D9A0464E764CF384DAFF2053; Path=/; HttpOnly
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=9CCB5304D9A0464E764CF384DAFF2053; Path=/; HttpOnly
< X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
< Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BMZB-KO3X-TZX9-9HY8_1e10301114b901011e14225009c30a596483c447_lin; Path=/
Set-Cookie: atlassian.xsrf.token=BMZB-KO3X-TZX9-9HY8_1e10301114b901011e14225009c30a596483c447_lin; Path=/
< X-ASESSIONID: v2923x
X-ASESSIONID: v2923x
< X-AUSERNAME: maria
X-AUSERNAME: maria
< Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store, no-transform
< Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
< Content-Length: 4
Content-Length: 4
< Date: Tue, 23 Nov 2021 15:29:54 GMT
Date: Tue, 23 Nov 2021 15:29:54 GMT
< Connection: close
Connection: close

<
* Closing connection 0
{code}
This can be confusing and results in extra efforts to investigate the reason behind the failure, which is basically caused by the project being removed from the context of one of the custom fields used in that request type. There is room for improvement in this context and here are some suggestions:
 # Improve the error handling so that the API returns a description of the error instead of a null/blank response.
 # Improve the user experience when adding a custom field to a project to make it more obvious which projects the field is being added to or removed from. The list only displays 5 projects while there could be a hundred projects used for that field. The way the UI currently works makes it very easy to make a mistake.
 # Add a warning when removing a custom field from a project if that custom field is still configured on request types.
 # If a custom field is no longer present in a project, add a warning on the screen when editing the request type's fields to indicate that the field is not present in the project.

h2. Note

This is not reproducible with all the custom fields' types. The behaviour was visible when using a DateTimePicker custom field but not with a simple text field.

+Steps to reproduce:+

1. Add a new custom field of type DateTimePicker to a Service Desk project.
2. Add that field to an issue type.
3. Create a new request type using the issue type, and add the new custom field to the request type.
4. Try to create a new request using your browser. This should work.
5. Remove the custom field from the project.
6. Try to create a new request using your browser. Using Developer Tools in Chrome you'll see that one of the resources loaded returns a status 500 response and the HTTP request will return Null with 500 error.
7. You can also try to create the request using the ServiceDesk API, and it too will return a status 500 response.
fields.summary: Improve the behavior and user experience of custom fields' context change

fields.description:
h3. Description
When adding any Insight post function to a Create Issue transition, the Insight post function is always placed first in the order among the rest, *before* one of the default post functions, "Creates the issue originally".

Without reordering the post functions, the Insight post function will not work as the requirement is that the "Creates the issue originally" post function must always be the first post function in a Create Issue transition. However, there's no warning on the screen to remind admins to reorder the post functions. This is also not mentioned in the documentation.

h3. Suggestions
* Automatically place Insight post functions after the "Creates the issue originally" post function or
* Include a reminder/warning on the screen for admins to reorder the post functions accordingly and
* Include this requirement in [this documentation about Insight post functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/post-functions-1044784443.html]
fields.summary: Reorder Insight post function(s) automatically in the Create Issue transitions or inform the admins on the screen

 !Screenshot 2021-11-23 at 15.21.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Object count report should show child inherited objects when selecting parent object type

h3. Actual Results
Object count report should show child inherited objects when selecting parent object type


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight object count report fails to retrieve child inherited objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have an Automation to Alert user (@mention), and when you create an issue from the Customer portal, after the Automation runs and adds the user @mention, the same user is getting added to the 'request participants' as well. The same behaviour is not noticed when you create the issue from Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation similar to the below -
!Screenshot 2021-11-23 at 7.50.40 PM.png|width=311,height=140!
 # Try creating an issue from the Customer portal which satisfies the Automation rule, this will add the @mention user automatically to the Request Participants
!Screenshot 2021-11-23 at 7.52.02 PM.png|width=353,height=184!

h3. Expected Results

The user is just added to the Comment as @mention and notified accordingly.
h3. Actual Results

The user is getting added to the Request participants as well.
h3. Workaround
Disable the mentions on customer portal feature. (i) Please note that this will disable mentions for all the customer portals. The alert automation will work as intended. To do this please add the below dark feature in your instance -
(on) To disable the portal mention feature : *sd.customer.portal.editor.mentions.disabled*
fields.summary: Alerting a user(@mention) via Automation adds the user to the Request Participants as well when the issue is created from Customer portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently, Insight will automatically move latest imported Discovery XML settings and imported data to the {{latest_imported_data}} directory. In some cases, Jira / Insight administrators do not have access to file systems to fetch those files, so it would be useful to either disable this or to be able to fetch / download the files from Insight directly.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement controls to disable storing the files into {{latest_imported_data}} or to be able to fetch / download the files from Insight directly.
fields.summary: Provide possibility to prevent or control moving latest Discovery import to latest_imported_data directory

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In Insight's main object view any user can see the connected Jira issues to the objects they're viewing.

Even though they may or may not have access to the issue itself it would be more secure if they don't see it at all. So having the option to enable/disable this feature would be handy.

!image-2021-11-22-21-31-29-169.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Being able to enable/disable "Connected Jira Issues"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hidden inherited attributes are cleared when user doesn't have permissions. This is a follow up of ICS-1863 where the bug did not get fixed completely.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Parent and Child Object Type with Inheritance on.
 # Create a hidden attribute on the Parent Object Type
 # Create a Child Object with the hidden attribute filled in
!Object.png|thumbnail! 
!Attribute.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a User that has User permissions for the Schema but Developer permissions for the Child
 !Users.png|thumbnail! 
!Schema Permission.png|thumbnail! 
!Object Type Permission.png|thumbnail!
 # Log in as user1, and edit the object *through the Object View* . Only need to make a change on the object's name \\
{noformat}
http://{JIRA}:{port}/secure/insight/assets/{Object-Key}{noformat}
(i) Issue does *not* occur if object is edited using the Schema View: \\
{noformat}
http://{JIRA}:{port}//secure/ObjectSchema.jspa?id=?&typeId=?&objectId=?{noformat}
 # The hidden attribute will not be visible. This is expected as the user doesn't have permissions
 # Once Edit the object Save
!Edit 1.png|thumbnail!
 # Log in back as an admin user to view all attribute values

h3. Expected Results

The hidden attribute remains unchanged
h3. Actual Results

The hidden attribute value is deleted
*History view*
!Result 1.png|thumbnail! 
*Object View*
!Result 2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hidden inherited attributes are cleared when user doesn't have permissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment Insight does not allow to reference/filters 2 object type from 2 different schemas in the same attribute.

In the future it would be useful to add this functionality.
fields.summary: provide the feature to reference object type from different schemas in one attribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The IQL to lookup objects with current user with the IQL anyAttribute= currentUser() does not work. This is a bug that happened since 8.6.0. It worked with 8.5.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a objectType with user attribute
 # populate the user attribute with your user which is logged in
 # Go to the advanced search and put the IQL anyAttribute = currentUser() nothing will be returned in version 8.6.0 and forward but it will work in version 8.5.0

Look at the screenshots, the one that returns results is version 8.5.0 and the one that shows an empty screen is 8.6.0

!Screenshot 2021-11-19 at 21.45.56.png|width=527,height=330!

!Screenshot 2021-11-19 at 21.50.37.png|width=525,height=296!
h3. Expected Results



anyAttribute = currentUser() should return results
h3. Actual Results

anyAttribute = currentUser() does not return anything

h3. Workaround

Do not know any workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Insight anyAttribute = currentUser() does not work

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The message that appears when an approver clicks the approve/reject button twice or two approvals happens simultaneously: "The approval has been decided" is not ideal.

It would be great if we could update this message.
fields.summary: Ability to change the "The approval has been decided" message

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer is trying fetch the data from all attributes from an ObjectType in Insight with A4j into an insight field in a Jira ticket. But currently it is only possible to do this with the name and ID attributes. They want to be able to do this with all attributes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install automation for Jira
 # Go to project Settings
 # Go to project automation
 # new action

Here there should be options where you could take values from other attributes then name or id

h3. Expected Results

Having options to take values from Insight attributes.
h3. Actual Results

There are no options that have that
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Using postfunctions With Insight
fields.summary: Insight filter more attributes then ID and Name with A4j

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring the reference type in the Insight referenced multiple field, the value does not get saved after selecting the type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to customfield - create Insight referenced multiple field
 # Try to select a value in reference type, see se "Updated field succesfully" appear but the field still says the default value which is "all reference type"

!Screenshot 2021-11-19 at 17.44.17.png|width=426,height=242!
h3. Expected Results

This field should be updated with the selected value
h3. Actual Results

It is not updated
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround known yet.
fields.summary: Insight referenced multiple field bug does not save configuration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when opening custom fields' Object picker, there is a Search bar where a user can search Objects based on keywords (e.g. part of name, Object Key, or some other field values). However, there is no way to do more precise search based on possible Attribute values (similar to Jira's basic issue search that presents possible fields' values).

h3. Suggested Resolution
Add additional filter based on possible Attribute values to the custom field Object filter. For example, add a list of Attributes on the left-hand side to additionally filter the Objects on the list:
 !image-2021-11-19-15-47-04-693.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add additional filter based on possible Attribute values to the custom field Object filter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customized Help Center welcome message is not taken into consideration on the finish signing up page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Jira Administration* > *Applications* > *Jira Service Management* > {*}Configuration{*}. 
# Enable Public signup and activate the "email verification required for signup" option
# On the same page, below {*}Help center{*}, select the link {*}View and customize{*}.
# Customize the Help Center *front page title*
!image-2021-11-19-14-02-31-277.png|width=209,height=132!
# Access the help center page and signup for a new account
# Click on the "Sign Up" button from the account verification email

h3. Expected Results

The page for finishing the signup contains the customized welcome message
h3. Actual Results

The page for finishing the signup contains the default "Welcome to Help Center" message instead of the customized welcome message

!image-2021-11-19-14-00-32-983.png|width=335,height=268!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The customized Help Center front page title (welcome message) is not taken into consideration on the finish signing up page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an object has multiples inbound references and a user does not have enough permission to view one of the them, Insight thrown an error AND no other inbound references are displays even though the user has access to. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create four object types (A, B, C, D)
# Object Type A is parent of B and C. Use Inheritance for Object Type A (Let the attributes be inherited by object type children) \\
  !Object Types.png|thumbnail! 
   !Inheritance configuration.png|thumbnail! 
# Object Type A has an Outbound Reference to Object Type D
# Create one object for each of the Object Types
# Now, Object D will have 3 Inbound References \\
  !Object Type D Inbound References.png|thumbnail! 
# Create 2 Jira Users (user1 and user2) and assign them an application access \\
   !Users.png|thumbnail! 
# Grant permission to user1 to see only Object Type B and not Object Type C \\
  !Permission_1.png|thumbnail! 
# Log in as _user1_ who should not see inbound references C and access the object view for object D \\
  !User1 View.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
Inbound references from AA and BB which user has access to should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The below error is displayed and no other Inbound references are shown.
  !Result-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inbound references fail to load when Object Type roles are set up

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center
